body: please upgrade to 4.5.5 as we had some memory consumption fixes.

all right, will do. can't report though if it helped, i've been running owncloud for about 2 months until this error occured.

edit: wow, that was easy. same error again, just a few hours later.
i'm posting some entries from my apache error.log now... it al started with several thousand lines of these:

	[sun dec 23 17:23:31 2012] [error] [client 46.x.x.x] client denied by server configuration: /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/data/htaccesstest.txt
	[sun dec 23 17:23:31 2012] [error] [client 46.x.x.x] file does not exist: /var/www/httpdocs/core

owncloud is located at `/var/www/httpdocs/owncloud`, so indeed, `/var/www/httpdocs/core` *does* not and *should* not exist.
after that, i got several thousand of these in random order:

	[sun dec 23 17:24:20 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php fatal error:  out of memory (allocated 11010048) (tried to allocate 72 bytes) in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/lib/db.php on line 169
	[sun dec 23 17:24:30 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php fatal error:  out of memory (allocated 8912896) (tried to allocate 523800 bytes) in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/lib/config.php on line 58
	[sun dec 23 17:25:07 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php fatal error:  out of memory (allocated 8388608) (tried to allocate 40961 bytes) in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/lib/template.php on line 407
	[sun dec 23 17:37:19 2012] [error] (12)cannot allocate memory: fork: unable to fork new process

so obviously, these issues started when the system was out of memory.
when i noticed this, i restarted the server and got the following messages a few hundred times in exactly this order:

	[sun dec 23 20:13:09 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php warning:  popen(file -i -b '/var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/data/**censored_user_file**' 2>/dev/null,r): cannot allocate memory in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/lib/helper.php on line 378
	[sun dec 23 20:13:09 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php warning:  fgets() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/lib/helper.php on line 379
	[sun dec 23 20:13:09 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php warning:  pclose() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/lib/helper.php on line 380

i guess this was the point where the windows client tried to sync and the server failed (again).
after that, i got the classic from above, which polluted my error.log with about 300 lines of error logs per second.

	[sun dec 23 20:24:32 2012] [error] (12)cannot allocate memory: fork: unable to fork new process
	[sun dec 23 20:24:35 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php warning:  domdocument::savexml(): memory allocation failed : growing buffer in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/dav/server.php on line 1933
	[sun dec 23 20:24:35 2012] [error] [client 92.x.x.x] php warning:  domdocument::savexml(): memory allocation failed : growing buffer in /var/www/httpdocs/owncloud/3rdparty/sabre/dav/server.php on line 1933
	(and so on for the next 20k lines)

well, i guess i'll have to stop using owncloud until that's fixed...
memory usage has been mentioned in documentation for quite some time (ie here http://owncloud.org/support/big-files/ ), while this issue was possible valid at the time, should this still be open?
closing this for now until someone reports this again.
